parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
Jewish, Judaic. From Ioudaios; Judaic, i.e. Resembling a Judaean.
An idle tale, fable, fanciful story. Perhaps from the same as mueo; a tale, i.e. Fiction.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To turn away, pervert, remove; I restore, replace; mid: I desert, reject. From apo and strepho; to turn away or back.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
